Sox sellout streak suspect?

The Red Sox declare a game sold out even if hundreds of tickets go unsold but others are given away for free, all to keep the streak of sold out home games alive. (Globe)
  • survey What do you think of the sellout streak?

Detectives investigating E. Boston death

Homicide detectives believe the victim was stabbed inside of a Chelsea Street apartment, staggered into an alley, collapsed, and then died. (Globe, 12:21 p.m.)

Toddler search to resume in Rockport

Officials said police will return to Rockport today to search for Caleigh Anne Harrison, who disappeared from a beach last month. (Globe, 10:11 a.m.)

115K jobs added in April as hiring slows

US employers added fewer jobs than expected in April, and the jobless rate dipped to 8.1 percent as more Americans gave up looking for work. (AP, 9:59 a.m.)

The LA Times reports Seau's brain will be examined for evidence of a condition associated with repetitive brain trauma. Seau committed suicide Wednesday. (Globe)

Benjamin Zander, fired by the New England Conservatory for hiring a convicted sex offender, will lead a new youth ensemble at the Boston Philharmonic Orchestra.
